name: T1
description: High-resolution MRI; white matter bright, gray matter darker. Good for anatomical details.

name: T2
description: MRI highlighting fluid and lesions; CSF bright, white matter darker. Useful for detecting pathology.

name: CT
description: X-ray-based; bone white, CSF dark, tissue gray. Quick for emergencies (fractures, bleeding).

name: DTI
description: MRI tracking water diffusion in white matter. Assesses structural brain connectivity.

name: DWI
description: MRI detecting water diffusion; bright in restricted areas (e.g., stroke). Sensitive to early brain changes.

name: FLAIR
description: MRI with dark CSF, enhancing lesions near fluid. Ideal for multiple sclerosis plaques.

name: fMRI
description: Measures brain activity via blood flow changes; active areas appear brighter. Useful for brain mapping.

name: MRA
description: MRI for blood vessels; vessels appear bright. Non-invasive, used for vascular conditions.

name: PET
description: Uses radioactive tracers to show brain metabolism; high activity areas bright. Diagnoses neurological conditions.

name: SWI
description: MRI sensitive to magnetic changes; iron and blood appear dark. Detects microbleeds and hemorrhages.
